summary: This is a transcript of a voluntary sworn interview conducted by the DOJ Office of the Inspector General (OIG) with a Federal Bureau of Prisons Senior Officer Specialist at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. The interview is part of the OIG investigation into the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein and the surrounding circumstances in August 2019. The witness discusses his duties, the inmate count procedures, and discrepancies in count slips on the nights before and of Epstein's death.

persons.name: Kimana Cale
persons.role: Senior Officer Specialist, Federal Bureau of Prisons
persons.context: The witness being interviewed. A BOP employee with 20 years of service who worked as Control One and Internal Two at the MCC on August 9-10, 2019, the shifts surrounding Epstein's death.

persons.name: Daniel Matulewicz
persons.context: One of the OIG agents conducting the interview. He leads the questioning about count procedures and discrepancies.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased high-profile inmate at the center of the OIG investigation. The interview focuses on the circumstances surrounding his death by suicide in the MCC SHU.

persons.name: Tova Noel
persons.context: A correctional officer assigned to the Special Housing Unit (SHU/Nine South) who signed count slips on August 9-10, 2019. Her handwriting is noted on documents.

persons.name: Michael Thomas
persons.context: A correctional officer assigned to the Special Housing Unit (SHU/Nine South) who signed count slips on August 10, 2019.

persons.name: Angel Fernandez
persons.context: An inmate in the SHU who was placed in a dry cell in R&D on August 9, 2019, after a contraband incident. His movement caused count discrepancies.

persons.name: Efrain Reyes
persons.context: Epstein's former cellmate who was transferred or released from the MCC on August 9, 2019, leaving Epstein without a cellmate.

persons.name: Nicole
persons.context: The Operations Lieutenant on duty the night of August 9-10, 2019. The witness reports to her, and she is implicated in authorizing or directing count slip annotations.

persons.name: Cannata
persons.context: A lieutenant listed on the duty roster who was relieved at 10:00 p.m. on August 9, 2019.

persons.name: Marrugo
persons.context: A correctional officer the witness initially thought he worked with on August 9, 2019, but later corrected.

persons.name: Dupre
persons.context: The Internal One officer working with the witness on August 10, 2019.

persons.name: Moore
persons.context: An OIG Special Agent present during the witness's prior interview and who witnessed a signed form.

connections.description: Cale reported to Operations Lieutenant Nicole during his shifts on August 9-10, 2019. He states she would have had to authorize any annotations on count slips.
Both were BOP staff working at the MCC. Cale received and processed count slips signed by Noel from the SHU.
Both were correctional officers assigned to the SHU (Nine South) and signed count slips together on August 10, 2019.
Reyes was Epstein's cellmate in the SHU before being transferred/released on August 9, 2019, leaving Epstein alone.
Noel was the SHU officer who observed Fernandez attempting to take contraband during a visit and initiated his removal to dry cell.

events.title: Inmate Fernandez moved to dry cell
events.description: Inmate Angel Fernandez was observed attempting to take contraband during a SHU visit at 1:40 p.m. He was subsequently placed in a dry cell in R&D (Receiving & Discharge) by at least 3:15 p.m., but was not properly keyed out of the SHU in the system.

events.title: Inmate Efrain Reyes removed from MCC
events.description: Epstein's cellmate, Efrain Reyes, was listed as 'WAB' (Will Accompanying Bureau) and was transferred or released from the MCC, leaving Epstein without a cellmate.

events.title: Discovery of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: A body alarm went off at approximately 6:33 a.m. in the SHU. Responding staff found Jeffrey Epstein in his cell. Medical staff performed CPR. Epstein was transported to the hospital where he was later pronounced dead.

events.title: Epstein's first alleged suicide attempt
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was allegedly involved in a first suicide attempt while at the MCC, after which he was placed on suicide watch.

events.title: OIG Interview of Kimana Cale
events.description: The DOJ Office of the Inspector General conducts a voluntary sworn interview with BOP Senior Officer Specialist Kimana Cale regarding the death of Jeffrey Epstein and count procedures.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), New York, New York
keyFacts: The witness, Kimana Cale, worked as Control One (4pm-midnight) on August 9, 2019, and as Internal Two (midnight-8am) on August 10, 2019, the shifts surrounding Epstein's death.

Significant discrepancies existed in inmate count slips for the SHU on August 9-10. Inmate Angel Fernandez was moved to a dry cell in R&D at 3:15 p.m. on August 9 but was not keyed out of the SHU, causing the SHU count to be off by one (reporting 73 instead of 72) for multiple counts.

The witness acknowledges writing '9S+1' on an R&D count slip and possibly a '+1' on a SHU count slip during the 10:00 p.m. count on August 9, stating it would have been at the direction of the Operations Lieutenant, Nicole, to reflect a 'ghost count.'

The witness states that Epstein's cellmate, Efrain Reyes, was removed from the MCC on August 9, leaving Epstein alone in his cell, and speculates that Epstein was prematurely removed from suicide watch.

The witness identifies systemic problems at the MCC, primarily a critical lack of staff, high turnover, and mandatory overtime, which he believes contributed to the failures leading to Epstein's death.
